Haec ars, says Vegetius, dimicaturis est necessaria, per quam vitam retineant, et victoriam consequantur. For this purpose, heroes themselves have used a sword, and a shield‚ with the one to offend the enemy, with the other to defend themselves. Cunning, agility‚ and the swiftness of their horses, were a shield, nay, better than any shield, to the Abipones. If they see one or two of their sellow-soldiers fall, they imme- diately fly.
